Question
========

From each of two normally distributed populations with equal variances a sample is drawn.______________. Sample 1: n = 13, mean = 36, sd = 4.9 Sample 2: n = 11, mean = 37, sd = 6.16. The pooled variance estimator takes the value 30.34. It is tested Whether the population averages are equal. The corresponding test size follows, if the null hypothesis is TRUE,

Answerlist
----------

* An F-distribution with 13 and 11 degrees of freedom
* A T distribution with 22 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 12 and 10 degrees of freedom
* A T distribution with 24 degrees of freedom

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* An F-distribution with 13 and 11 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* A T-division with 22 degrees of freedom: Correct
* An F-division with 12 and 10 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* A T-division with 24 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
